intro: Taraxacum karelicum, commonly known as the Karelian dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to northern Europe and parts of Russia, typically found in meadows and grasslands. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and a single yellow flower head that develops into a distinctive white pappus. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils. The plant has no significant commercial value but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
